logic

Class NextGeneration

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.NextGeneration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Ruleset

    public class NextGeneration
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ruleset
    Next generation calculates the next-current generation. This class takes care of neighbour counting and calculation of the next generation.

      • getNextGenerationClone

        public NextGeneration getNextGenerationClone()
        Deepclone method for Next Generation object. Deepclones the current instance of NextGeneration.
        Returns:
        a deepclone of the current NextGeneration object.

      • calcNextGen

        public byte[][] calcNextGen(byte[][] currGen)
        Calculating next generation. Based on the number of neighbours all the cells on the board has, and the ruleset that is currently being used. The default ruleset is Conway's.
        Parameters:
        currGen - is the current generation to be calculated.
        Returns:
        the new current generation, in other words the next generation.

      • countNeighbours

        protected static int countNeighbours(int i,
                                     int j,
                                     byte[][] currentGen)
        Counts all the cells neighbours.
        Parameters:
        i - is the x-position in the generation to be counted.
        j - is the y-position in the generation to be counted.
        currentGen - is the generation to be counted.
        Returns:
        is the number of neighbours the cell has.

      • checkBorders

        protected static int checkBorders(int i,
                                  int j,
                                  byte[][] currentGen)
        Is a support method for countNeighbours. It tries to check the current cell, and throws a ArrayIndexOutOfBounds if it is outside the borders.
        Parameters:
        i - x-position of the cell being checked.
        j - y-position of the cell being checked.
        currentGen - is the current generation to be checked.
        Returns:
        0 if the position is out of bounds, else the value of the generation being checked.

      • decodeRuleset

        public void decodeRuleset(java.lang.String ruleB,
                          java.lang.String ruleS)
        Decodes rulesets from userinput and RLE file/url. This ruleset is being used in the calcNextGen method. It allows a diffrent variation of the game. The input is checked with a matcher, and throws PatternFormatException if the ruleset was invalid.
        Specified by:
        decodeRuleset in interface Ruleset
        Parameters:
        ruleB - ruleB String that contains number chars. Representing when a cell should be born.
        ruleS - ruleS String that contains number chars. Representing when a cell should survive.

      • setBorn

        public void setBorn(boolean[] birth)
        Born rules gives restrictions for when a cell should be born. It is tested on dead cells only.
        Specified by:
        setBorn in interface Ruleset
        Parameters:
        birth - is a boolean[9].

      • setSurvives

        public void setSurvives(boolean[] surviving)
        Survives rules gives restrictions for when a cell should survive. It is tested on live cells only.
        Specified by:
        setSurvives in interface Ruleset
        Parameters:
        surviving - is a boolean[9].
